tweet_content:
Here's a quick thread on what's covered in the data wrangling and analysis section of Going Deeper with R. 

https://rforthe.rest/deeper

One of the cool things about R is you can download data directly from R using the download.file() function. 

https://www.math.ucla.edu/~anderson/rw1001/library/base/html/download.file.html

Excel. It's ubiqituous. Learn how to import data using the read_excel function from the {readxl} package. 

https://readxl.tidyverse.org/reference/read_excel.html

Once you have your data imported, the first step is to tidy it. Learn about the principles of tidy data in this article.

https://tidyr.tidyverse.org/articles/tidy-data.html

You often need to reshape your data. The pivot_longer() function is often really helpful here. 

https://tidyr.tidyverse.org/articles/pivot.html
